content: If you were to stack pennies on top of each other, how tall would a stack of 10,000 pennies be?

A penny has a thickness of about 1.52 millimeters. So, if you stack 10,000 pennies on top of each other, the total height would be:

10,000 pennies * 1.52 mm/penny = 15,200 mm

To convert millimeters to meters, you divide by 1,000:

15,200 mm / 1,000 = 15.2 meters

So, a stack of 10,000 pennies would be approximately 15.2 meters tall.
